result.execSummary: Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael Douglas Brantner

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Michael Douglas Brantner in court with attorney Peter J. Morin.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State moves to dismiss.  Court finds that under present evidence subject to any new or additional information, believe defendant is not competent to proceed & won't become competent within the remaining commitment period.  Defendant is discharged & released.  Case dismissed without prejudice.
Mailed copy of Psych. Report to counsel for defendant & DA.

records.descr: DE not competent to stand trial, case suspended

records.addlTxt: Order for Competency Examination by DHS
Competency hearing on September 16, 2014 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Michael Douglas Brantner in court with attorney Peter J. Morin.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Morin requests Competency Examination after trying to complete the Waiver of Rt. to Prelim. Hrg. with defendant.  Atty. Morin agrees time limits for P.H. suspended.  Court finds probable cause based on complaint for purposes of evaluation.  Court orders competency examination on outpatient basis.
Adjourned initial appearance on July 21, 2014 at 09:15 am.

Defendant Michael Douglas Brantner in court with attorney Peter J Morin.  Jon D Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives time limits for P.H.  Court reviews Bond with defendant.  Referred to Scheduling Clerk.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: Defendant Michael Douglas Brantner in court, in custody.   Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Judge advises defendant of charges/max. penalties and rights including the right to a preliminary hearing on Count 1 w/in 10 days if in custody, 20 days if not.  State requests $1000 Sign. Bond with conditions:  No contact with Ace Hardware or Countryside Coop.; No contact with co-defendants.  Court sets $1000 Sign. Bond with conditions:  No contact with Ace Hardware, Countryside Coop.; No contact with Jacob Gilbert or Benjamin Ross; no other violations of law; show up for all court dates.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for May 20, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
